overview_summary: All of the neighboring landowners identified have not publicly stated positions on the project, so their stances remain unknown. None hold notable sway in local affairs; each appears to have low community influence with no official roles. Their focus is likely on practical concerns like thorough environmental cleanup and safeguarding property values, given their long-term residence near the former industrial site.

neighbors.name: Gary C. Tollner
neighbors.claims: Gary C. Tollner owns a property directly neighboring the former Tonawanda Coke plant site ([www.wkbw.com](https://www.wkbw.com/news/wny-development/riverview-innovation-technology-campus-buys-tonawanda-coke-site#:~:text=Tonwanda%20Coke%20was%20shut%20down,surrounding%20community%2C%20and%20the%20environment)). His surname is shared with Tollner Painting, Inc., suggesting an association with that local contractor business ([www.thebluebook.com](https://www.thebluebook.com/iProView/8265/tollner-painting-inc/subcontractors/locations-contacts/#:~:text=Tollner%20Painting%2C%20Inc.%20,email%20address%20that%20will%20download)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out personally, emphasizing the project’s thorough environmental cleanup and how renewed site use can boost local property values.

neighbors.name: William H. Mislin Jr.
neighbors.claims: William H. Mislin Jr. (b. 1925) was a longtime Tonawanda resident who passed away in December 2007 ([www.ancientfaces.com](https://www.ancientfaces.com/directory/name/william-mislin#:~:text=William%20H%20Jr%20Mislin%20Dec,21%2C%202007%20Tonawanda%2C%20New%20York)). His name remains listed on parcel 65.09-4-3.11, indicating the property is held under his estate ([www.ancientfaces.com](https://www.ancientfaces.com/directory/name/william-mislin#:~:text=William%20H%20Jr%20Mislin%20Dec,21%2C%202007%20Tonawanda%2C%20New%20York)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Communicate via the family or estate representative, honoring their long-time connection to the land and assuring the project will respect local heritage while improving the site.

neighbors.name: Joseph Mann
neighbors.claims: Joseph Mann owns parcel 65.09-4-5, making him a direct neighbor to the Riverview Innovation site ([www.cacwny.org](https://www.cacwny.org/blog-2/page/16/#:~:text=Jon%20Williams%20of%20Riverview%20Innovation,monumental%2C%20though%20purely%20symbolic%2C%20event)). He has not been publicly active in civic matters or taken a clear stance on the development ([www.heraldstaronline.com](https://www.heraldstaronline.com/obituaries/2022/08/joseph-mann-2/#:~:text=Joseph%20Mann%20,Mann%2C%20age%2069)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Invite him to project information sessions and emphasize transparency in environmental remediation as well as minimal impact on his property.

neighbors.name: David Battaglia
neighbors.claims: David Battaglia is a long-term community member, having attended Tonawanda High School in the early 1960s ([www.idcrawl.com](https://www.idcrawl.com/david-battaglia#:~:text=David%20Battaglia)). He owns parcel 65.09-4-1.1 near the project site and has not publicly supported or opposed the development, apart from general safety concerns shared by area residents ([www.cacwny.org](https://www.cacwny.org/blog-2/page/16/#:~:text=Jon%20Williams%20of%20Riverview%20Innovation,monumental%2C%20though%20purely%20symbolic%2C%20event)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a trusted local figure discuss the project with him, highlighting that it will maintain neighborhood peace and ensure safety through proper cleanup.
